2025-12-27 20:35:08.800 | DEBUG    | metagpt.provider.base_llm:aask:205 - [{'role': 'system', 'content': '\n\nYou are a Team Leader, named Mike, your goal is Manage a team to assist users.  The current time is 2025-12-27 20:35:08.\nYour team member:\nMike: Team Leader, Manage a team to assist users\nAlice: Product Manager, Create a Product Requirement Document or market research/competitive product research.\nBob: Architect, design a concise, usable, complete software system. output the system design.\nAlex: Engineer, Take on game, app, web development and deployment.\nDavid: DataAnalyst, Take on any data-related tasks, such as data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, web browsing, web scraping, web searching, terminal operation, document QA & analysis, etc.\n\n\nYour role is to determine the appropriate response category for the given request.\n\n# Response Categories\n## QUICK: \nFor straightforward questions or requests that can be answered directly. This includes common-sense inquiries, legal or logical questions, basic math, short coding tasks, multiple-choice questions, greetings, casual chat, daily planning, and inquiries about you or your team.\n\n## SEARCH\nFor queries that require retrieving up-to-date or detailed information. This includes time-sensitive or location-specific questions like current events or weather. Use this only if the information isn\'t readily available.\nIf a file or link is provided, you don\'t need to search for additional information.\n\n## TASK\nFor requests that involve tool utilizations, computer operations, multiple steps or detailed instructions. Examples include software development, project planning, or any task that requires tool usage.\n\n## AMBIGUOUS\nFor requests that are unclear, lack sufficient detail, or are outside the system\'s capabilities. Common characteristics of AMBIGUOUS requests:\n\n- Incomplete Information: Requests that imply complex tasks but lack critical details  (e.g., "Redesign this logo" without specifying design requirements).\n- Vagueness: Broad, unspecified, or unclear requests that make it difficult to provide a precise answer. \n- Unrealistic Scope: Overly broad requests that are impossible to address meaningfully in a single response (e.g., "Tell me everything about...").\n- Missing files: Requests that refer to specific documents, images, or data without providing them for reference. (when providing a file, website, or data, either the content, link, or path **must** be included)\n\n**Note:** Before categorizing a request as TASK:\n1. Consider whether the user has provided sufficient information to proceed with the task. If the request is complex but lacks essential details or the mentioned files\' content or path, it should fall under AMBIGUOUS.\n2. If the request is a "how-to" question that asks for a general plan, approach or strategy, it should be categorized as QUICK.\n\n\n# Example\n\n1. Request: "How do I design an online document editing platform that supports real-time collaboration?"\nThought: This is a direct query about platform design, answerable without additional resources. \nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n2. Request: "What\'s the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning in machine learning?"\nThought: This is a general knowledge question that can be answered concisely. \nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n3. Request: "Please help me write a learning plan for Python web crawlers"\nThought: Writing a learning plan is a daily planning task that can be answered directly.\nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n4. Request: "Can you help me find the latest research papers on deep learning?"\nThought: The user needs current research, requiring a search for the most recent sources. \nResponse Category: SEARCH.\n\n5. Request: "Build a personal website that runs the Game of Life simulation."\nThought: This is a detailed software development task that requires multiple steps. \nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n6. Request: "Summarize this document for me."\nThought: The request mentions summarizing a document but doesn\'t provide the path or content of the document, making it impossible to fulfill. \nResponse Category: AMBIGUOUS.\n\n7. Request: "Summarize this document for me \'/data/path/docmument.pdf\'." \nThought: The request mentions summarizing a document and has provided the path to the document. It can be done by reading the document using a tool then summarizing it.\nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n8. Request: "Optimize this process." \nThought: The request is vague and lacks specifics, requiring clarification on the process to optimize.\nResponse Category: AMBIGUOUS.\n\n9. Request: "Change the color of the text to blue in styles.css, add a new button in web page, delete the old background image."\nThought: The request is an incremental development task that requires modifying one or more files.\nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': '[Message] from User to Mike: \n\nBased on the following use case, write a complete program in Java. DONT omit any necessary info such as path, link, environment, programming language, framework, requirement, constraint from original content to team members because you are their sole info source.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to the user directly, DON\'T ask your team members.\nPay close attention to messages from team members. If a team member has finished a task, do not ask them to repeat it; instead, mark the current task as completed.\nNote:\n1. If the requirement is a pure DATA-RELATED requirement, such as web browsing, web scraping, web searching, web imitation, data science, data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, text-to-image etc. DON\'T decompose it, assign a single task with the original user requirement as instruction directly to Data Analyst.\n2. If the requirement is developing a software, game, app, or website, excluding the above data-related tasks, you should decompose the requirement into multiple tasks and assign them to different team members based on their expertise. The standard software development process has four steps: creating a Product Requirement Document (PRD) by the Product Manager -> writing a System Design by the Architect -> creating tasks by the Project Manager -> and coding by the Engineer. You may choose to execute any of these steps. When publishing message to Product Manager, you should directly copy the full original user requirement.\n2.1. If the requirement contains both DATA-RELATED part mentioned in 1 and software development part mentioned in 2, you should decompose the software development part and assign them to different team members based on their expertise, and assign the DATA-RELATED part to Data Analyst David directly.\n2.2. For software development requirement, estimate the complexity of the requirement before assignment, following the common industry practice of t-shirt sizing:\n - XS: snake game, static personal homepage, basic calculator app\n - S: Basic photo gallery, basic file upload system, basic feedback form\n - M: Offline menu ordering system, news aggregator app\n - L: Online booking system, inventory management system\n - XL: Social media platform, e-commerce app, real-time multiplayer game\n - For XS and S requirements, you don\'t need the standard software development process, you may directly ask Engineer to write the code. Otherwise, estimate if any part of the standard software development process may contribute to a better final code. If so, assign team members accordingly.\n3.1 If the task involves code review (CR) or code checking, you should assign it to Engineer.\n4. If the requirement is a common-sense, logical, or math problem, you should respond directly without assigning any task to team members.\n5. If you think the requirement is not clear or ambiguous, you should ask the user for clarification immediately. Assign tasks only after all info is clear.\n6. It is helpful for Engineer to have both the system design and the project schedule for writing the code, so include paths of both files (if available) and remind Engineer to definitely read them when publishing message to Engineer.\n7. If the requirement is writing a TRD and software framework, you should assign it to Architect. When publishing message to Architect, you should directly copy the full original user requirement.\n8. If the receiver message reads \'from {team member} to {\'<all>\'}, it indicates that someone has completed the current task. Note this in your thoughts.\n9. Do not use the \'end\' command when the current task remains unfinished; instead, use the \'finish_current_task\' command to indicate completion before switching to the next task.\n10. Do not use escape characters in json data, particularly within file paths.\n11. Analyze the capabilities of team members and assign tasks to them based on user Requirements. If the requirements ask to ignore certain tasks, follow the requirements.\n12. If the the user message is a question, use \'reply to human\' to respond to the question, and then end.\n13. Instructions and reply must be in the same language.\n14. Default technology stack is Vite, React, MUI, Tailwind CSS. Web app is the default option when developing software. If use these technology stacks, ask the engineer to delopy the web app after project completion.\n15. You are the only one who decides the programming language for the software, so the instruction must contain the programming language.\n16. Data collection and web/software development are two separate tasks. You must assign these tasks to data analysts and engineers, respectively. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are a product manager AI assistant specializing in product requirement documentation and market research analysis. \nYour work focuses on the analysis of problems and data.\nYou should always output a document.\n\n## Core Tools\n1. Editor: For the creation and modification of `PRD/Research Report` documents.\n2. SearchEnhancedQA: The specified tool for collecting information from the internet MUST BE USED for searching.\n3. Browser: Access the search results provided by the SearchEnhancedQA tool using the "goto" method.\n\n## Mode 1: PRD Creation\nTriggered by software/product requests or feature enhancements, ending with the output of a complete PRD.\n\n### Required Fields\n1. Language & Project Info\n   - Language: Match user\'s language\n   - Programming Language: If not specified in the requirements, use Vite, React, MUI, Tailwind CSS.\n   - Project Name: Use snake_case format\n   - Restate the original requirements\n\n2. Product Definition(**IMPORTANT** )\n   - Product Goals: 3 clear, orthogonal goals\n   - User Stories: 3-5 scenarios in "As a [role], I want [feature] so that [benefit]" format\n   - Competitive Analysis: 5-7 products with pros/cons\n   - Competitive Quadrant Chart(Required): Using Mermaid\n\n3. Technical Specifications\n   - Requirements Analysis: Comprehensive overview of technical needs\n   - Requirements Pool: List with P0/P1/P2 priorities\n   - UI Design Draft: Basic layout and functionality\n   - Open Questions: Unclear aspects needing clarification\n\n#### Mermaid Diagram Rules\n1. Use mermaid quadrantChart syntax. Distribute scores evenly between 0 and 1\n2. Example:\n```mermaid\nquadrantChart\n    title "Reach and engagement of campaigns"\n    x-axis "Low Reach" --> "High Reach"\n    y-axis "Low Engagement" --> "High Engagement"\n    quadrant-1 "We should expand"\n    quadrant-2 "Need to promote"\n    quadrant-3 "Re-evaluate"\n    quadrant-4 "May be improved"\n    "Campaign A": [0.3, 0.6]\n    "Campaign B": [0.45, 0.23]\n    "Campaign C": [0.57, 0.69]\n    "Campaign D": [0.78, 0.34]\n    "Campaign E": [0.40, 0.34]\n    "Campaign F": [0.35, 0.78]\n    "Our Target Product": [0.5, 0.6]\n```\n\n### PRD Document Guidelines\n- Use clear requirement language (Must/Should/May)\n- Include measurable criteria\n- Prioritize clearly (P0: Must-have, P1: Should-have, P2: Nice-to-have)\n- Support with diagrams and charts\n- Focus on user value and business goals\n\n## Mode 2: Market Research\nTriggered by market analysis or competitor research requests, ending with the output of a complete report document.\n\n### **IMPORTANT** Information Collection Requirements\n\nMust follow this strict information gathering process:\n1. Keyword Generation Rules:\n   - Infer 3 distinct keyword groups on user needs(Infer directly instead of using tools).\n   - Each group must be a space-separated phrase containing:\n     * Target industry/product name (REQUIRED)\n     * Specific aspect or metric\n     * Time frame or geographic scope when relevant\n\n   Example format:\n   - Group 1: "electric vehicles market size forecast 2024"\n   - Group 2: "electric vehicles manufacturing costs analysis"\n   - Group 3: "electric vehicles consumer preferences survey"\n\n2. Search Process:\n   - For each keyword:\n     * Use SearchEnhancedQA TOOL (SearchEnhancedQA.run) collect top 3 search results\n     * Remove duplicate URLs\n   \n3. Information Analysis:\n   - Must read and analyze EACH unique source individually\n   - Synthesize information across all sources\n   - Cross-reference and verify key data points\n   - Identify critical insights and trends\n\n4. Quality Control:\n   - Verify data consistency across sources\n   - Fill information gaps with targeted additional research\n   - Ensure balanced perspective from multiple sources\n\n\n### Report Structure\n1. Summary: Key findings and recommendations\n2. Industry Overview: Market size, trends, and structure\n3. Market Analysis: Segments, growth drivers, and challenges\n4. Competitor Landscape: Key players and positioning\n5. Target Audience Analysis: User segments and needs\n6. Pricing Analysis: Market rates and strategies\n7. Key Findings: Major insights and opportunities\n8. Strategic Recommendations: Action items\n9. Append: Supporting data\n\n\n### Final Report Requirements\n1. Report must be entirely focused on insights and analysis:\n   - No mention of research methodology\n   - No source tracking or process documentation\n   - Present only validated findings and conclusions\n   \n2. Professional Format:\n   - Clear section hierarchy\n   - Rich subsection content\n   - Evidence-based analysis\n   - Data visualization where appropriate\n   \n3. Content Depth Requirements:\n   Executive Summary (500+ words):\n   - Key Market Metrics\n   - Critical Findings\n   - Strategic Recommendations\n   \n   Industry Overview (800+ words):\n   - Market Size and Growth\n   - Industry Value Chain\n   - Regulatory Environment\n   - Technology Trends\n   \n4. Quality Standards:\n   - Every main section must have 3+ detailed subsections\n   - Each subsection requires 200-300 words minimum\n   - Include specific examples and data points\n   - Support all major claims with market evidence\n\n### Research Guidelines\n- Base all analysis on collected data\n- Include quantitative and qualitative insights\n- Support claims with evidence\n- Maintain professional formatting\n- Use visuals to support key points\n\n## Document Standards\n1. **\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE restaurant_points (\n    point_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,\n    restaurant_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,\n    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,\n    business_hours VARCHAR(50),\n └───────────────┘\n```\n\n## 6.     \n\n### 6.1      \n\n#### 6.1.1      (Controller)\n```java\n@RestController\n@RequestMapping(\"/api/restaurant-points\")\npublic class RestaurantPointController {\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @GetMapping(\"/{pointId}\")\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @PostMapping\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\n            Principal principal) {\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @PutMapping(\"/{pointId}\")\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\n            Principal principal) {\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\n    }\n}\n```\n\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\n```java\n@Service\ntransactional\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private OperationLogService logService;\n    \n    /**\n     *         -             \n     */\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\n        // 1.       \n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\n            throw new ValidationException(\"      \", validation.getErrors());\n        }\n        \n        // 2.      \n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\"      \"));\n        \n        // 3.       \n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\n        \n        // 4.     \n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\n        \n        // 5.     \n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\n    }\n}\n```\n\n### 6.2     \n\n#### 6.2.1       \n```java\n/**\n *       -         \n */\n@Component\npublic class DataValidator {\n    \n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = \n        Pattern.compile(\"^[+]?[0-9]{10,15}$\");\n    private static final Pattern BUSINESS_HOURS_PATTERN = \n        Pattern.compile(\"^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$\");\n    \n    /**\n     *            \n     */\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\n        \n        //       \n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \"    \", result);\n        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), \"  \", result);\n        \n        //         \n        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && !point.getPhoneNumber().isEmpty()) {\n            validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\n        }\n        \n        //         \n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\n        }\n        \n        //       \n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\n        \n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\n            result.addError(\"phoneNumber\", \"         \");\n        }\n    }\n}\n```\n\n## 7.     \n\n### 7.1     \n\n#### 7.1.1     \n-         \n-       \n-        \n\n#### 7.1.2     \n- API    \n-        \n-       \n\n#### 7.1.3      \n-         \n-       \n-    \n    @Autowired\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @GetMapping(\"/{pointId}\")\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @PostMapping\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\n            Principal principal) {\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @PutMapping(\"/{pointId}\")\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\n            Principal principal) {\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\n    }\n}\n```\n\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\n```java\n@Service\ntransactional\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private OperationLogService logService;\n    \n    /**\n     *         -             \n     */\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\n        // 1.       \n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\n            throw new ValidationException(\"      \", validation.getErrors());\n        }\n        \n        // 2.      \n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\"      \"));\n        \n        // 3.       \n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\n        \n        // 4.     \n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\n        \n        // 5.     \n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\n    }\n}\n```\n\n### 6.2     \n\n#### 6.2.1       \n```java\n/**\n *       -         \n */\n@Component\npublic class DataValidator {\n    \n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = \n        Pattern.compile(\"^[+]?[0-9]{10,15}$\");\n    private static final Pattern BUSINESS_HOURS_PATTERN = \n        Pattern.compile(\"^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$\");\n    \n    /**\n     *            \n     */\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\n        \n        //       \n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \"    \", result);\n        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), \"  \", result);\n        \n        //         \n        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && !point.getPhoneNumber().isEmpty()) {\n            validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\n        }\n        \n        //         \n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\n        }\n        \n        //       \n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\n        \n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\n            result.addError(\"phoneNumber\", \"         \");\n        }\n    }\n}\n```\n\n## 7.     \n\n### 7.1     \n\n#### 7.1.1     \n-         \n-       \n-        \n\n#### 7.1.2     \n- API    \n-        \n-       \n\n#### 7.1.3      \n-         \n-       \n- └───────────────┘\n```\n\n## 6.     \n\n### 6.1      \n\n#### 6.1.1      (Controller)\n```java\n@RestController\n@RequestMapping("/api/restaurant-points")\npublic class RestaurantPointController {\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @GetMapping("/{pointId}")\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @PostMapping\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\n            Principal principal) {\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     *        \n     */\n    @PutMapping("/{pointId}")\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\n            Principal principal) {\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\n    }\n}\n```\n\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\n```java\n@Service\ntransactional\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\n    \n    @Autowired\n    private OperationLogService logService;\n    \n    /**\n     *         -             \n     */\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\n        // 1.       \n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\n            throw new ValidationException("      ", validation.getErrors());\n        }\n        \n        // 2.      \n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException("      "));\n        \n        // 3.       \n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\n        \n        // 4.     \n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\n        \n        // 5.     \n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\n    }\n}\n```\n\n### 6.2     \n\n#### 6.2.1       \n```java\n/**\n *       -         \n */\n@Component\npublic class DataValidator {\n    \n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = \n        Pattern.compile("^[+]?[0-9]{10,15}$");\n    private static final Pattern BUSINESS_HOURS_PATTERN = \n        Pattern.compile("^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$");\n    \n    /**\n     *            \n     */\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\n        \n        //       \n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), "    ", result);\n        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), "  ", result);\n        \n        //         \n        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && !point.getPhoneNumber().isEmpty()) {\n            validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\n        }\n        \n        //         \n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\n        }\n        \n        //       \n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\n        \n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\n            result.addError("phoneNumber", "         ");\n        }\n    }\n}\n```\n\n## 7.     \n\n### 7.1     \n\n#### 7.1.1     \n-         \n-       \n-        \n\n#### 7.1.2     \n- API    \n-        \n-       \n\n#### 7.1.3      \n-         \n-       \n- 106|**restaurant_points  **
107|```sql
108|CREATE TABLE restaurant_points (
109|    point_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,
110|    restaurant_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
111|    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
112|    business_hours VARCHAR(50),
113|    contact_person VARCHAR(50),
114|    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
115|    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'ACTIVE',
116|    last_updated TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
117|    updated_by VARCHAR(50)
118|);
119|```
120|
121|**refreshment_data  **
122|```sql
123|CREATE TABLE refreshment_data (
124|    refreshment_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,
125|    point_id VARCHAR(50) REFERENCES restaurant_points(point_id),
126|    data_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
127|    data_value TEXT,
128|    timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
129|    validated BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
130|    INDEX idx_point_id (point_id)
131|);
132|```
133|
134|**operation_logs  **
135|```sql
136|CREATE TABLE operation_logs (
137|    log_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
138|    operation_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
139|    point_id VARCHAR(50) REFERENCES restaurant_points(point_id),
140|    operator_id VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
141|    operation_time TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
142|    old_data JSON,
143|    new_data JSON,
144|    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'SUCCESS',
145|    error_message TEXT
146|);
147|```

\\n\\n**restaurant_points  **\\n```sql\\nCREATE TABLE restaurant_points (\\n    point_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,\\n    restaurant_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,\\n    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,\\n ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PostMapping\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PutMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\\n```java\\n@Service\\ntransactional\\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private OperationLogService logService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *         -             \\n     */\\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\\n        // 1.       \\n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\\n            throw new ValidationException(\\"      \\", validation.getErrors());\\n        }\\n        \\n        // 2.      \\n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\\"      \\"));\\n        \\n        // 3.       \\n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\\n        \\n        // 4.     \\n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\\n        \\n        // 5.     \\n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### 6.2     \\n\\n#### 6.2.1       \\n```java\\n/**\\n *       -         \\n */\\n@Component\\npublic class DataValidator {\\n    \\n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = \\n\\n**restaurant_points  **\\n```sql\\nCREATE TABLE restaurant_points (\\n    point_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,\\n    restaurant_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,\\n    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,\\n RestaurantPointController {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @GetMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PostMapping\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PutMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\\n```java\\n@Service\\ntransactional\\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private OperationLogService logService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *         -             \\n     */\\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\\n        // 1.       \\n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\\n            throw new ValidationException(\\"      \\", validation.getErrors());\\n        }\\n        \\n        // 2.      \\n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\\"      \\"));\\n        \\n        // 3.       \\n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\\n        \\n        // 4.     \\n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\\n        \\n        // 5.     \\n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### 6.2     \\n\\n#### 6.2.1       \\n```java\\n/**\\n *       -         \\n */\\n@Component\\npublic class DataValidator {\\n    \\n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = \\n        Pattern.compile(\\"^[+]?[0-9]{10,15}$\\");\\n    private static final Pattern BUSINESS_HOURS_PATTERN = \\n        Pattern.compile(\\"^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$\\");\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *            \\n     */\\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \\"    \\", result);\\n        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), \\"  \\", result);\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && !point.getPhoneNumber().isEmpty()) {\\n            validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\\n        \\n        return result;\\n    }\\n    \\n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\\n            result.addError(\\"phoneNumber\\", \\"         \\");\\n        }\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n## 7.     \\n\\n### 7.1     \\n\\n#### 7.1.1     \\n-         \\n-       \\n-        \\n\\n#### 7.1.2     \\n- API    \\n-        \\n-       \\n\\n#### 7.1.3 129|/**
130| *        -             
131| */
132|public class RestaurantPoint {
133|    private String pointId;          //    ID
134|    private String restaurantName;   //     
135|    private String address;          //   
136|    private String businessHours;    //     
137|    private String contactPerson;    //    
138|    private String phoneNumber;      //     
139|    private Status status;           //   (  /  /  )
140|    private Date lastUpdated;        //       
141|    private String updatedBy;        //    
142|    
143|    //     
144|    public enum Status {
145|        ACTIVE,   //   
146|        MAINTENANCE,  //   
147|        CLOSED    //   
148|    }
149|}
150|```
151|
152|#### RefreshmentData (     )
153|```java
154|/**
155| *          -            
156| */
157|public class RefreshmentData {
158|    private String refreshmentId;    //    ID
159|    private String pointId;          //       ID
160|    private String dataType;         //     
161|    private Object dataValue;        //    
162|    private Date timestamp;          //    
163|    private boolean validated;       //      
164|}
165|```
166|
167|### 4.2      
168|
169|#### 4.2.1    
170|
171|**restaurant_points  **
172|```sql
173|CREATE TABLE restaurant_points (
174|    point_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,
175|    restaurant_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
176|    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
177|    business_hours VARCHAR(50),
178|    contact_person VARCHAR(50),
179|    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
180|    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'ACTIVE',
181|    last_updated TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
182|    updated_by VARCHAR(50)
183|);
184|```
185|
186|**refreshment_data  **
187|```sql
188|CREATE TABLE refreshment_data (
189|    refreshment_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,
190|    point_id VARCHAR(50) REFERENCES restaurant_points(point_id),
191|    data_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
192|    data_value TEXT,
193|    timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
194|    validated BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
195|    INDEX idx_point_id (point_id)
196|);
197|```

200|```sql

**:      \\"HH:MM-HH:MM\\"\\n4. **    **:       /        \\n5. **  **:          \\n\\n#### 4.3.2       \\n1.             \\n2.         24     \\n3.                \\"  \\"\\n4.                 \\n\\n## 5.     \\n\\n### 5.1     \\n\\n```\\n┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐\\n│                          (UI Layer)                      │\\n│  - Layer)                │\\n│  - RestaurantPointDAO       - RefreshmentDataDAO            │\\n│  - OperationLogDAO          -                         │\\n└──────────────────────┬──────────────────────────────────────┘\\n                       │\\n┌──────────────────────▼──────────────────────────────────────┐\\n│                   (Persistence Layer)                   │\\n│  -        (MySQL/PostgreSQL)                          │\\n│  -      (Redis)                                         │\\n│  - **    **: Spring Data JPA/Hibernate\\n- **    **: Hibernate Validator\\n- **API  **: RESTful API\\n- **    **: Maven   Gradle\\n\\n####       (  ，   )\\n- **  **: React   Vue.js\\n- **UI **: Ant Design   Material-UI\\n- **    **: Redux   Vuex\\n- **    **: Webpack/Vite\\n\\n####    \\n- **    **: PostgreSQL 14+   MySQL 8+\\n- **  **: Redis 7+\\n- **    **:           \\n\\n### 5.3            -                            │\\n└──────────────────────┬──────────────────────────────────────┘\\n                       │\\n             ┌─────────┴─────────┐\\n             │                   │\\n    ┌────────▼──────┐   ┌────────▼──────┐\\n    │           │   │           │\\n    │(PostgreSQL/   │   │(Redis)        │\\n    │ MySQL)        │   │               │\\n    └───────────────┘   └───────────────┘\\n```\\n\\n## 6.     \\n\\n### 6.1      \\n\\n#### 6.1.1      (Controller)\\n```java\\n@RestController\\n@RequestMapping(\\"/api/restaurant-points\\")\\npublic class RestaurantPointController {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @GetMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PostMapping\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PutMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\\n```java\\n@Service\\ntransactional\\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private OperationLogService logService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *         -             \\n     */\\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\\n        // 1.       \\n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\\n            throw new ValidationException(\\"      \\", validation.getErrors());\\n        }\\n        \\n        // 2.      \\n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\\"      \\"));\\n        \\n        // 3.       \\n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\\n        \\n        // 4.     \\n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\\n        \\n        // 5.     \\n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### 6.2     \\n\\n#### 6.2.1       \\n```java\\n/**\\n *       -         \\n */\\n@Component\\npublic class DataValidator {\\n    \\n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = \\n        Pattern.compile(\\"^[+]?[0-9]{10,15}$\\");\\n    private static final Pattern BUSINESS_HOURS_PATTERN = \\n        Pattern.compile(\\"^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$\\");\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *            \\n     */\\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \\"    \\", result);\\n        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), \\"  \\", result);\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && !point.getPhoneNumber().isEmpty()) {\\n            validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\\n        \\n        return result;\\n    }\\n    \\n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\\n            result.addError(\\"phoneNumber\\", \\"         \\");\\n        }\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n## 7.     \\n\\n### 7.1     \\n\\n#### 7.1.1     \\n-         \\n-       \\n-        \\n\\n#### 7.1.2     \\n- API    \\n-        \\n-       \\n\\n#### 7.1.3 Summary: Key findings and recommendations\n2. Industry Overview: Market size, trends, and structure\n3. Market Analysis: Segments, growth drivers, and challenges\n4. \\n\\n**restaurant_points  **\\n```sql\\nCREATE TABLE restaurant_points (\\n    point_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,\\n    restaurant_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,\\n    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,\\n  └───────────────┘\\n```\\n\\n## 6.     \\n\\n### 6.1      \\n\\n#### 6.1.1      (Controller)\\n```java\\n@RestController\\n@RequestMapping(\\"/api/restaurant-points\\")\\npublic class RestaurantPointController {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @GetMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PostMapping\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PutMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\\n```java\\n@Service\\ntransactional\\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private OperationLogService logService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *         -             \\n     */\\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\\n        // 1.       \\n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\\n            throw new ValidationException(\\"      \\", validation.getErrors());\\n        }\\n        \\n        // 2.      \\n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\\"      \\"));\\n        \\n        // 3.       \\n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\\n        \\n        // 4.     \\n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\\n        \\n        // 5.     \\n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### 6.2     \\n\\n#### 6.2.1       \\n```java\\n/**\\n *       -         \\n */\\n@Component\\npublic class DataValidator {\\n    \\n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = \\n        Pattern.compile(\\"^[+]?[0-9]{10,15}$\\");\\n    private static final Pattern BUSINESS_HOURS_PATTERN = \\n        Pattern.compile(\\"^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$\\");\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *            \\n     */\\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \\"    \\", result);\\n        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), \\"  \\", result);\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && !point.getPhoneNumber().isEmpty()) {\\n            validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\\n        \\n        return result;\\n    }\\n    \\n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\\n            result.addError(\\"phoneNumber\\", \\"         \\");\\n        }\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n## 7.     \\n\\n### 7.1     \\n\\n#### 7.1.1     \\n-         \\n-       \\n-        \\n\\n#### 7.1.2     \\n- API    \\n-        \\n-       \\n\\n#### 7.1.3 RestaurantPointController {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @GetMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PostMapping\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PutMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\\n```java\\n@Service\\ntransactional\\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private OperationLogService logService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *         -             \\n     */\\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\\n        // 1.       \\n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\\n            throw new ValidationException(\\"      \\", validation.getErrors());\\n        }\\n        \\n        // 2.      \\n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\\"      \\"));\\n        \\n        // 3.       \\n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\\n        \\n        // 4.     \\n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\\n        \\n        // 5.     \\n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### 6.2     \\n\\n#### 6.2.1       \\n```java\\n/**\\n *       -         \\n */\\n@Component\\npublic class DataValidator {\\n    \\n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = Pattern.compile(\\"^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$\\");\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *            \\n     */\\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \\"    \\", result);\\n validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\\n        \\n        return result;\\n    }\\n    \\n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\\n            result.addError(\\"phoneNumber\\", \\"         \\");\\n        }\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n## 7.     \\n\\n### 7.1     \\n\\n#### 7.1.1     \\n-         \\n-       \\n-        \\n\\n#### 7.1.2     \\n- API    \\n-        \\n-       \\n\\n#### 7.1.3 RestaurantPointController {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @GetMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PostMapping\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\\n            @Valid @RequestBody ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PutMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\\n```java\\n@Service\\ntransactional\\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private OperationLogService logService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *         -             \\n     */\\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\\n        // 1.       \\n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\\n            throw new ValidationException(\\"      \\", validation.getErrors());\\n        }\\n        \\n        // 2.      \\n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\\"      \\"));\\n        \\n        // 3.       \\n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\\n        \\n        // 4.     \\n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\\n        \\n        // 5.     \\n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### 6.2     \\n\\n#### 6.2.1       \\n```java\\n/**\\n *       -         \\n */\\n@Component\\npublic class DataValidator {\\n    \\n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = Pattern.compile(\\"^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$\\");\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *            \\n     */\\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \\"    \\", result);\\n        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), \\"  \\", result);\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && !point.getPhoneNumber().isEmpty()) {\\n            validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\\n        \\n        return result;\\n    }\\n    \\n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\\n            result.addError(\\"phoneNumber\\", \\"         \\");\\n        }\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n## 7.     \\n\\n### 7.1     \\n\\n#### 7.1.1     \\n-         \\n-       \\n-        \\n\\n#### 7.1.2     \\n- API    \\n-        \\n-       \\n\\n#### 7.1.3 ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PostMapping\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PutMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\\n```java\\n@Service\\ntransactional\\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private OperationLogService logService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *         -             \\n     */\\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\\n        // 1.       \\n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\\n            throw new ValidationException(\\"      \\", validation.getErrors());\\n        }\\n        \\n        // 2.      \\n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\\"      \\"));\\n        \\n        // 3.       \\n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\\n        \\n        // 4.     \\n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\\n        \\n        // 5.     \\n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### 6.2     \\n\\n#### 6.2.1       \\n```java\\n/**\\n *       -         \\n */\\n@Component\\npublic class DataValidator {\\n    \\n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = {\\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \\"    \\", result);\\n \\n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\\n            result.addError(\\"phoneNumber\\", \\"         \\");\\n        }\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n## 7.     \\n\\n### 7.1     \\n\\n#### 7.1.1     \\n-         \\n-       \\n-        \\n\\n#### 7.1.2     \\n- API    \\n-        \\n-       \\n\\n#### 7.1.3 \\n\\n**restaurant_points  **\\n```sql\\nCREATE TABLE restaurant_points (\\n    point_id VARCHAR(50) PRIMARY KEY,\\n    restaurant_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,\\n    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,\\n RestaurantPointController {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointService pointService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @GetMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PostMapping\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> createRestaurantPoint(\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setCreatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint created = pointService.createPoint(point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *        \\n     */\\n    @PutMapping(\\"/{pointId}\\")\\n    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> updateRestaurantPoint(\\n            @PathVariable String pointId,\\n            @Valid @RequestBody RestaurantPoint point,\\n            Principal principal) {\\n        point.setUpdatedBy(principal.getName());\\n        RestaurantPoint updated = pointService.updatePoint(pointId, point);\\n        return ResponseEntity.ok(updated);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n#### 6.1.2     (Service)\\n```java\\n@Service\\ntransactional\\npublic class RestaurantPointService {\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private DataValidator dataValidator;\\n    \\n    @Autowired\\n    private OperationLogService logService;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *         -             \\n     */\\n    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\\n        // 1.       \\n        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\\n        if (!validation.isValid()) {\\n            throw new ValidationException(\\"      \\", validation.getErrors());\\n        }\\n        \\n        // 2.      \\n        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\\n            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(\\"      \\"));\\n        \\n        // 3.       \\n        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\\n        \\n        // 4.     \\n        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\\n        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\\n        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\\n        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\\n        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\\n        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\\n        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\\n        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\\n        \\n        // 5.     \\n        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### 6.2     \\n\\n#### 6.2.1       \\n```java\\n/**\\n *       -         \\n */\\n@Component\\npublic class DataValidator {\\n    \\n    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = \\n        Pattern.compile(\\"^[+]?[0-9]{10,15}$\\");\\n    private static final Pattern BUSINESS_HOURS_PATTERN = \\n        Pattern.compile(\\"^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$\\");\\n    \\n    /**\\n     *            \\n     */\\n    public ValidationResult validate(RestaurantPoint point) {\\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateRequiredField(point.getRestaurantName(), \\"    \\", result);\\n        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), \\"  \\", result);\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && !point.getPhoneNumber().isEmpty()) {\\n            validatePhoneNumber(point.getPhoneNumber(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //         \\n        if (point.getBusinessHours() != null && !point.getBusinessHours().isEmpty()) {\\n            validateBusinessHours(point.getBusinessHours(), result);\\n        }\\n        \\n        //       \\n        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\\n        \\n        return result;\\n    }\\n    \\n    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\\n        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\\n            result.addError(\\"phoneNumber\\", \\"         \\");\\n        }\\n    }\\n}\\n```\\n\\n## 7.     \\n\\n### 7.1     \\n\\n#### 7.1.1     \\n-         \\n-       \\n-        \\n\\n#### 7.1.2     \\n- API    \\n-        \\n-       \\n\\n#### 7.1.3 DONT omit any necessary info such as path, link, environment, programming language, framework, requirement, constraint from original content to team members because you are their sole info source.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to the user directly, DON\'T ask your team members.\nPay close attention to messages from team members. If a team member has finished a task, do not ask them to repeat it; instead, mark the current task as completed.\nNote:\n1. If the requirement is a pure DATA-RELATED requirement, such as web browsing, web scraping, web searching, web imitation, data science, data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, text-to-image etc. DON\'T decompose it, assign a single task with the original user requirement as instruction directly to Data Analyst.\n2. If the requirement is developing a software, game, app, or website, excluding the above data-related tasks, you should decompose the requirement into multiple tasks and assign them to different team members based on their expertise. The standard software development process has four steps: creating a Product Requirement Document (PRD) by the Product Manager -> writing a System Design by the Architect -> creating tasks by the Project Manager -> and coding by the Engineer. You may choose to execute any of these steps. When publishing message to Product Manager, you should directly copy the full original user requirement.\n2.1. If the requirement contains both DATA-RELATED part mentioned in 1 and software development part mentioned in 2, you should decompose the software development part and assign them to different team members based on their expertise, and assign the DATA-RELATED part to Data Analyst David directly.\n2.2. For software development requirement, estimate the complexity of the requirement before assignment, following the common industry practice of t-shirt sizing:\n - XS: snake game, static personal homepage, basic calculator app\n - S: Basic photo gallery, basic file upload system, basic feedback form\n - M: Offline menu ordering system, news aggregator app\n - L: Online booking system, inventory management system\n - XL: Social media platform, e-commerce app, real-time multiplayer game\n - For XS and S requirements, you don\'t need the standard software development process, you may directly ask Engineer to write the code. Otherwise, estimate if any part of the standard software development process may contribute to a better final code. If so, assign team members accordingly.\n3.1 If the task involves code review (CR) or code checking, you should assign it to Engineer.\n4. If the requirement is a common-sense, logical, or math problem, you should respond directly without assigning any task to team members.\n5. If you think the requirement is not clear or ambiguous, you should ask the user for clarification immediately. Assign tasks only after all info is clear.\n6. It is helpful for Engineer to have both the system design and the project schedule for writing the code, so include paths of both files (if available) and remind Engineer to definitely read them when publishing message to Engineer.\n7. If the requirement is writing a TRD and software framework, you should assign it to Architect. When publishing message to Architect, you should directly copy the full original user requirement.\n8. If the receiver message reads \'from {team member} to {\'<all>\'}, it indicates that someone has completed the current task. Note this in your thoughts.\n9. Do not use the \'end\' command when the current task remains unfinished; instead, use the \'finish_current_task\' command to indicate completion before switching to the next task.\n10. Do not use escape characters in json data, particularly within file paths.\n11. Analyze the capabilities of team members and assign tasks to them based on user Requirements. If the requirements ask to ignore certain tasks, follow the requirements.\n12. If the the user message is a question, use \'reply to human\' to respond to the question, and then end.\n13. Instructions and reply must be in the same language.\n14. Default technology stack is Vite, React, MUI, Tailwind CSS. Web app is the default option when developing software. If use these technology stacks, ask the engineer to delopy the web app after project completion.\n15. You are the only one who decides the programming language for the software, so the instruction must contain the programming language.\n16. Data collection and web/software development are two separate tasks. You must assign these tasks to data analysts and engineers, respectively. Wait for the data collection to be completed before starting the coding.\n\n'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': '[Message] from User to Mike: \n\nBased on the following use case, write a complete program in Java. Make sure to include all necessary functions, classes, and imports. Ensure the code is correct, efficient, and handles edge cases.\n\nUse Case:\nUse case name: ModifyRefreshmentPoint \nDescription: Change data point associated refreshment. \nParticipating Actor: initialization Operator Point Of Restaurants \nEntry conditions: The Point Restaurant Operator has successfully authenticated to the system. \nFlow of events User System: \n1. RestaurantPointRepository pointRepository;\n499|    \n500|    @Autowired\n501|    private DataValidator dataValidator;\n502|    \n503|    @Autowired\n504|    private OperationLogService logService;\n505|    \n506|    /**\n507|     *         -             \n508|     */\n509|    public RestaurantPoint updatePoint(String pointId, RestaurantPoint newData) {\n510|        // 1.       \n511|        ValidationResult validation = dataValidator.validate(newData);\n512|        if (!validation.isValid()) {\n513|            throw new ValidationException("      ", validation.getErrors());\n514|        }\n515|        \n516|        // 2.      \n517|        RestaurantPoint existingPoint = pointRepository.findById(pointId)\n518|            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException("      "));\n519|        \n520|        // 3.       \n521|        logService.logUpdateOperation(existingPoint, newData);\n522|        \n523|        // 4.     \n524|        existingPoint.setRestaurantName(newData.getRestaurantName());\n525|        existingPoint.setAddress(newData.getAddress());\n526|        existingPoint.setBusinessHours(newData.getBusinessHours());\n527|        existingPoint.setContactPerson(newData.getContactPerson());\n528|        existingPoint.setPhoneNumber(newData.getPhoneNumber());\n529|        existingPoint.setStatus(newData.getStatus());\n530|        existingPoint.setUpdatedBy(newData.getUpdatedBy());\n531|        existingPoint.setLastUpdated(new Date());\n532|        \n533|        // 5.     \n534|        return pointRepository.save(existingPoint);\n535|    }\n536|}\n537|```\n538|\n539|### 6.2     \n540|\n541|#### 6.2.1       \n542|```java\n543|/**\n544| *       -         \n545| */\n546|@Component\n547|public class DataValidator {\n548|    \n549|    private static final Pattern PHONE_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]-([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$");\n553|    \n554|    /**\n555|     *            \n556|     */\n557|    public ValidationResult ", result);\n562|        validateRequiredField(point.getAddress(), "  ", result);\n563|        \n564|        //         \n565|        if (point.getPhoneNumber() != null && \n575|        validateBusinessRules(point, result);\n576|        \n577|        return result;\n578|    }\n579|    \n580|    private void validatePhoneNumber(String phone, ValidationResult result) {\n581|        if (!PHONE_PATTERN.matcher(phone).matches()) {\n582|            result.addError("phoneNumber", "         ");\n583|        }\n584|    }\n585|}\n586|```\n587|\n588|## 7. RestaurantPointService pointService;\\n453|    \\n454|    /**\\n455|     *        \\n456|     */\\n457|    @GetMapping("/{pointId}")\\n458|    public ResponseEntity<RestaurantPoint> getRestaurantPoint(\\n459|            @PathVariable String pointId) {\\n460|        RestaurantPoint point = pointService.getPointById(pointId);\\n461|        return ResponseEntity.ok(point);\\n462|      return ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.CREATED).body(created);\\n474|    }\\n475|    \\n476|    /**\\n477|     *        \\n478|     */\\n479|    @PutMapping("/{pointId}")\\n480|    public
